summary: This is a grand jury transcript from November 14, 2019, in the Southern District of New York. An FBI Special Agent testifies about the investigation into the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 10, 2019. The testimony focuses on the failure of correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas to conduct required inmate counts and rounds on the night of Epstein's death, and their subsequent falsification of records.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: One of the defendants in the investigation. A correctional officer at MCC assigned to the Special Housing Unit (SHU). Testified to have falsified count slips and 30-minute round forms, and failed to conduct required checks on the night of Epstein's death.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.role: Correctional Officer/Materials Handler Supervisor at MCC, Defendant
persons.context: One of the defendants in the investigation. Employed at MCC since 2007, worked overtime shifts as a correctional officer in the SHU. Along with Noel, failed to conduct counts and rounds, falsified records, and was present when Epstein was found.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: An inmate at MCC detained pending trial on sex trafficking charges. Housed in the SHU. Found unresponsive in his cell on August 10, 2019, and later pronounced dead. The investigation centers on the circumstances surrounding his death.

persons.name: Isaac Gardner
persons.role: Assistant United States Attorney, Acting Grand Jury Reporter
persons.context: The Assistant United States Attorney questioning the FBI Special Agent before the grand jury. Also certified the transcript as the Acting Grand Jury Reporter.

persons.name: FBI Special Agent
persons.role: FBI Special Agent, Violent Crimes Task Force
persons.context: The witness testifying before the grand jury. Describes the investigation into Epstein's death, including video review, interviews, and record analysis. States that Noel and Thomas falsified records and failed to perform duties.

connections.description: Correctional officers who were on duty together in the SHU during the early morning hours of August 10, 2019. They jointly failed to conduct institutional counts and 30-minute rounds, and jointly falsified the related records.
Noel was the correctional officer responsible for the SHU where Epstein was housed. She failed to conduct welfare checks on him as required.
Thomas was the correctional officer on duty with Noel in the SHU. He responded to the previous July 23 incident involving Epstein and was present when Epstein was found unresponsive on August 10.
The FBI agent investigated Noel's actions, reviewed video evidence of her not performing duties, and analyzed her falsified count slips and round forms.
The FBI agent investigated Thomas's actions, reviewed video evidence, and analyzed his falsified records and computer activity during his shift.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein arrested and arrives at MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is arrested and arrives at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in Manhattan pending trial on sex trafficking charges.

events.title: Epstein assigned to Special Housing Unit (SHU)
events.description: Epstein is assigned to the SHU at MCC due to being a high-profile inmate and having risk factors for suicide identified by MCC psychologists.

events.title: Epstein found with sheet around neck
events.description: Epstein is found on the floor of his SHU cell with a bed sheet around his neck. Officer Michael Thomas was among those who responded. Epstein is placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein returned to SHU with cellmate
events.description: Epstein is transferred back to the SHU from psychological observation. Psychology staff recommend he be housed with a cellmate, and he is assigned one.

events.title: Epstein's cellmate transferred out
events.description: Epstein's cellmate is transferred out of MCC in a routine, pre-arranged transfer. Epstein is not reassigned a new cellmate.

events.title: Officers fail to conduct counts and rounds
events.description: Correctional Officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas fail to conduct the required 4 p.m., 10 p.m., 12 a.m., 3 a.m., and 5 a.m. institutional counts, as well as all required 30-minute rounds. They falsify the corresponding count slips and round forms.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein found dead
events.description: At approximately 6:33 a.m., an alarm is activated in the SHU. Epstein is found unresponsive in his cell. Officer Thomas performs CPR. A nurse attempts revival, but Epstein is pronounced dead. The medical examiner later rules it a suicide by hanging.

events.title: Grand Jury testimony
events.description: An FBI Special Agent testifies before a grand jury regarding the investigation into Epstein's death and the conduct of correctional officers Noel and Thomas.

locations: United States Courthouse, Foley Square, New York, New York
Special Housing Unit (SHU), 9th floor of MCC
keyFacts: Correctional Officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas failed to conduct five consecutive mandatory inmate welfare counts (4 p.m., 10 p.m., 12 a.m., 3 a.m., 5 a.m.) on August 9-10, 2019, while Jeffrey Epstein was in their unit.
Noel and Thomas falsified official count slips and approximately 75 entries on 30-minute round forms, claiming they had performed these duties when video evidence shows they did not.
During their shift, Noel and Thomas were observed at their desk using computers for personal activities (searching for furniture sales, motorcycle sales, sports news) instead of performing rounds.

Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at approximately 6:33 a.m. on August 10, 2019. Shortly after, Noel and Thomas admitted to a supervisor that they 'messed up' and had not done the 3 a.m. or 5 a.m. counts.
The FBI investigation found no evidence in bank records that Noel or Thomas were bribed or received unusual influxes of cash related to Epstein's death.
